## Quick Summary: 📝
BlenderMCP integrates Blender with Claude AI using the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling AI-assisted 3D modeling, scene creation, and manipulation. It allows Claude to directly interact with and control Blender through a socket-based server, facilitating object manipulation, material control, scene inspection, and code execution within Blender.

## Key Takeaways: 💡

* ✅ Seamless integration of Claude AI with Blender for natural language 3D modeling.

* ✅ Significant time savings and increased efficiency in 3D modeling workflows.

* ✅ User-friendly design accessible even to developers without AI expertise.

* ✅ Support for object manipulation, material control, and code execution within Blender.

* ✅ Active development and a vibrant community for support and collaboration.


## Project Statistics: 📊

## Tech Stack: 💻
- ✅ Python


Tired of spending hours painstakingly modeling 3D objects?  Imagine a world where you could simply describe your vision in natural language, and an AI would bring it to life in Blender. That's the promise of BlenderMCP, a groundbreaking project that connects Blender to Claude AI, opening up exciting new possibilities for 3D artists and developers. BlenderMCP uses the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to facilitate a seamless two-way conversation between Blender and Claude.  This means you can use natural language prompts to control almost every aspect of your 3D scene. Want to create a detailed spaceship?  Just describe it to Claude, and watch as Blender constructs it based on your instructions.  Need to modify the materials?  A simple prompt will update the textures and colors. The beauty of BlenderMCP lies in its simplicity.  It's designed to be user-friendly, even for developers who aren't AI experts.  The architecture is fairly straightforward: a Blender add-on acts as a bridge, communicating with a Python server that handles the interaction with Claude. This server implements the MCP protocol, ensuring efficient and reliable communication.  Installation is surprisingly smooth.  You'll need Blender 3.0 or newer, Python 3.10 or higher, and the uv package manager (easily installed via brew on Mac or PowerShell on Windows).  Once set up, you'll be amazed at how quickly you can start creating complex 3D models.  What truly sets BlenderMCP apart is its potential benefits for developers.  It drastically reduces the time and effort required for many common 3D modeling tasks, allowing you to focus on the creative aspects of your projects.  It also simplifies complex processes, making it easier to experiment and iterate on your designs.  The ability to directly control Blender through natural language opens up a whole new level of flexibility. Imagine generating 3D models based on text descriptions, using Claude's advanced capabilities to create intricate details and realistic textures. BlenderMCP supports various features including object manipulation, material control, and even code execution within Blender.  This means you can automate repetitive tasks, extend Blender's functionality with custom scripts, and seamlessly integrate AI into your workflow.  The project is actively developed and supported by a passionate community, ensuring that it continues to improve and evolve.  Join the Discord community to share your feedback, collaborate with other developers, and contribute to the project's growth. This isn't just about creating 3D models; it's about pushing the boundaries of what's possible with AI and 3D modeling.  It's about empowering creators with tools that were previously unimaginable.  If you're looking to revolutionize your 3D workflow and take your creations to the next level, BlenderMCP is a must-have tool.  Check it out today and start building the future of 3D modeling!
